quests.name: Getting Started
quests.description: To begin Ars Magica, you require an Arcane Compendium. To obtain one, place a book inside of an item frame in front of a pool of liquid etherium. The Compendium is set to unlock all knowledge rather than staged progression. This quest line serves to give a rough path of progression through the book. Take special care to take your magic level into consideration when attempting high level combat.

quests.name: Spell Writing
quests.description: To begin writing your first spell, you will need to craft an Occulus and an Inscription Table. The Occulus allows you to unlock new spells with skill points that you have acquired, while the inscription table allows you to write your spells down in order to later craft them. It is recommended you allocate your skill points so that you may craft an actual spell. Do not place one point in each tree. More info is available in the next quest.

quests.name: Crafting Altar
quests.description: The most important part of Ars Magica is spell crafting and usage. You can combine many spell components together to form new and customized spells. In order to begin crafting spells, you must first construct the Multiblock Crafting Altar. Consult the Structures tab in the Compendium for the exact layout of the crafting altar. Once created, you may use the inscription table with your book and quill to obtain a spell recipe. A spell requires at least one shape and component to function. Place your recipe on the lectern and throw one blank rune into the altar to begin the crafting process.

tasks.longDescription: The altar can be created based on your available resources. The better the altar, the more powerful your spells can become. Consult the compendium for modification of the altar.

quests.name: Skill Points
quests.description: You can obtain additional skill points through several methods. The most common method is through levelling up your magic level. Every even level that you progress will grant one skill point. Types of skill points earned through level are dependent on the level that you have reached. You may also obtain skill points by finding Infinity Orbs. Infinity Orbs can be found in dungeon chests as well as drops off of AM2 boss monsters.

quests.name: Magical Worldgen
quests.description: Ars Magica adds many flora and ores to the world. Many of these will be required in certain spells and related blocks.

quests.name: Etherium
quests.description: Etherium is the main "power" system of Ars Magica and is used to power many blocks and is involved in some spell creation. The most basic form of Etherium is Neutral Etherium. You can create neutral Etherium by burning Vinteum Dust or Liquid Etherium inside of an Obelisk. In order to transfer Etherium from one block to another, you must bind the Obelisk to the designated block or Crafting Altar with the Crystal Wrench. In order to use Etherium in the crafting altar, ensure that the source is linked and flip the lever. The Magitech Staff and Goggles will reveal the amount of Etherium inside of blocks when used.

tasks.longDescription: By default, the Obelisk must be within 10 blocks of the desired binding.

quests.name: Special Etherium
quests.description: While Neutral Etherium can be used in a variety of means, there are two more types of Etherium with their own special properties. In order to produce Dark and Light Etherium, you must first obtain their respective key blocks through Rituals. In order to transform your obelisks, consult the Ritual section in the Structure tab for information on layout.

quests.name: Etherium Conduit
quests.description: You may extend the range of accessibly Etherium from an Obelisk by using an Etherium Conduit. The Etherium Conduit can transport Etherium an additional 10 blocks up to 100 blocks away from the original source.

quests.name: Mage Armor
quests.description: You can construct armor that is specifically attuned to your demands as a mage. Wearing a full set of Mage Armor will increase your mana regen as well as increase the power of your spells. Magical Armors can be repaired with current mana reserves, and the armor is highly enchantable.

quests.name: Armor Imbuement
quests.description: As you may have noticed, hovering over all types of armor and holding shift will reveal an Armor exp and level value. AM2 allows all armors to gain levels and in turn, use those levels in the Armor Imbuement Table. These special enchantments will assist you as a mage by reducing burnout, increasing exp gains, step assist, as well as many damage reductions. This allows you to create your own form of "mage armor" if the AM2 provided armor is not as good as another mod's armor you have choosen to wear.

quests.name: Essence Refiner
quests.description: Some items or spells will require various essences in order to be created. The Essence Refiner will create various types of essences when given Etherium and a Recipe. Check the section on Essence under the Items tab for more information on how to craft a specific essence.

quests.name: Battle Mage Armor
quests.description: Battle Mage Armor provides similar benefits as the mage armor, but to a lesser degree. However, the tradeoff is that Battle Mage Armor provides many more bonuses against physical damage, useful if the mage armor wasn't enough.

quests.name: Guardians
quests.description: One way to test your strength as a mage is to summon various guardians. Guardians have unique abilities and attacks, and are extremely bulky. They are usually immune to phsyical damage by swords, so crafting powerful attack spells with a hefty amount of mana regen would be in your favor. Each boss will drop an Infinity Orb and has a chance to drop their respective Essence. Rarely, they can also drop a unique piece of equipment. Each boss has a unique method of summoning, consult the boss tab for more information.

quests.name: Spell Book
quests.description: As you grow your collection of spells, your inventory will soon suffer. To aide this, you can craft a spell book that will contain a large amount of spells that can be cycled through with Shift-Scrolling.

quests.name: Arcane Deconstruction
quests.description: By feeding an Arcane Deconstructor with Dark Etherium, you can break down old spells or items into their original crafting components.

quests.name: Special Stones
quests.description: Along with standard world generation, Ars Magica also adds two more stones that are obtained through other means. Moon Stone can fall onto the world around mages with a level higher than 10, and Sun Stone can be found where lava is abundant.

quests.name: Reconstructing
quests.description: By feeding Etherium into an Arcane Reconstructor, you can repair mundane tools and items. May not work on some modded items.

quests.name: 404 Flicker Quest Not Found
quests.description: More Information on the Flicker system coming soon.
